entries.meaning: (law, textual criticism) A handwritten document that is solely the work of the person whose signature it bears, especially a letter, deed, or will; an original manuscript, a protograph.

examples: But when a holograph is placed backwards in its holder and illuminated with laser light, it can produce a real image  […]

verbs.description: holograph (third-person singular simple present holographs, present participle holographing, simple past and past participle holographed)

entries.meaning: To record by means of holography.
